document_data.name: Esmel Torlath
document_data.mainbody: King '''Esmel Torlath I''', known as "Serrus the Great,"<ref group="note">Serrus meant "Great General" in an obscure Amnian dialect, making his title "Great General the Great." was the legendary first king of [[Amn]] and the founder of the [[Torlath]] dynasty.
document_data.Possessions: Esmel bore the magical blade ''[[Namarra]]'', "The Sword That Never Sleeps." It was passed down to his descendants for several generations until Prince [[Ereskas Torlath]].{{Cite dragon/74/Seven Swords|22}}
document_data.Activities: King Esmel set about building Amn as a proper realm with an eye to the future, not a mere warlord's domain. One of the first projects he ordered was the construction of the [[King's Arch]] over the [[River Esmel]], while one of the last was the construction of the new capital of [[Esmeltaran]], only completed the year after his death.
document_data.Relationships: Esmel's grandchildren included [[Imnel Torlath I|Imnel I]] and [[Amnur Torlath|Amnur]], each of them a heroic figure in their own right.
document_data.History:
The [[Shoon Imperium]] was shattered in the {{YearlinkName|450}}, following the sacking of [[Shoonach]] and killing of Emperor [[Amahl Shoon VII]] by King [[Strohm I]] of [[Tethyr]]. A period of civil war ensued as nobles and courtiers fought among each other to claim the empty throne. In [[460 DR]] the Western Emirate of Amin was claimed by the native-born General Esmel, who declared himself the King of Amn and first of the Torlath dynasty. At the time, his domain consisted of the city-states of [[Athkatla]], [[Murann]], and [[Crimmor]], with the furthest territories extending to [[Lake Esmel]].

In the {{YearlinkName|479}}, his son Prince Imnel led the armies of Amn against the [[ogre]]s of the [[Small Teeth]] in a series of battles called the [[Ogre Wars]]. During the battle of [[Imnel's Scar]], his son discovered the [[Armory of Nedeheim]], a cache of powerful magical giant-made weapons that were stored away in Athkatla.

[[Calishite]] nobles led an expedition in [[491 DR]] to conquer and colonize the lands east of Amn, absorbing [[Valashar]] and [[Meiritin]] and building [[Eshpurta]]. Hostilities with the oppressive and violent realm would continue on and off for centuries.

King Esmel died in [[511 DR]], and was succeeded by his grandson Imnel.
